intro: Spergella saginella, commonly known as the common liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a small, mat-forming moss-like plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rock crevices. The plant has a thalloid structure composed of a flattened, leaf-like body with a central strand of cells. Its reproductive structures, called capsules, are borne on stalks and contain spores for dispersal. Spergella saginella plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
